posts.name: Dallen Barnett
posts.cooked: basically when our robot is on our cart and the wheels aren’t touching the ground, it drives fine. but when it’s on the ground it spins. i’m using path planner, SDS MK4 with CANCoders and NEOs and a navx2 gyro. i used YAGSL example for my drive code and path planner setup. here is my code: GitHub - thelaw2457/TheLaw2457_Reefscape

posts.name: icemannie
posts.cooked:
Your back right drive has true for its inversion, all others are false.

Also, front left can ids start at 1. 1 is normally the PDP .

posts.name: Sam Bowling
posts.cooked: The PDP is settable. We have ours at 63. It doesn’t have to be 1, we have our drive IDs also start at 1.

posts.name: Tim Winters
posts.cooked: CAN IDs can be the same for different device types

posts.name: Dallen Barnett
posts.cooked: it drives fine in teleop with that one inverted though

posts.name: icemannie
posts.cooked: Does your gyro increase positive when turning cow? Is it rio mxp mounted?

posts.name: Dallen Barnett
posts.cooked: i can’t remember for sure about the rotation but i’m pretty sure it’s positive when going counterclockwise. it is plugged into the mxp port.

posts.name: icemannie
posts.cooked: So it only spins using pathplanner?

posts.name: icemannie
posts.cooked: Can you confirm this? When to invert? | YAGSL

posts.name: Dallen Barnett
posts.cooked: it’s positive when ccw and i followed the inversion guide and went back over it a couple times when setting up the code

posts.name: icemannie
posts.cooked:
I ran auto in Simulation and it works correctly.

Pathplanner paths spinning robot - Technical / Java - Chief Delphi

plus more threads on topic
